item.title: How Long Is Atomfall: Campaign Length Revealed
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/how-long-is-atomfall-campaign-length-revealed/1100-6530368/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Atomfall is a new open world, survival RPG that’s set in a post-apocalyptic version of 1950s England. A radioactive disaster has just occurred, and you’re locked inside the “Quarantine Zone” without any recollection as to how you got there or what’s happening around you. From the moment the game opens up to you, you’re able to go anywhere, complete any quest you come across, and explore numerous different areas within the game’s open-world zones.

The way Atomfall is designed makes it a different experience for every player. This can make it difficult to nail down just how long it takes to beat the game, as some players will take longer to reach the end than others based on the path they take. However, you can see a general timeframe for how long it takes to reach the end credits of Atomfall in the guide below.

How long is Atomfall - Campaign length

For most players, Atomfall will take roughly 15-20 hours to beat. This is contingent on completing the main story and taking time to explore the different zones in the game, as you often don’t have exact quest markers to guide you to your next objective.

The way Atomfall works, though, can either expedite or prolong this timeline. There are actually several different main story questlines that you can embark on throughout the game, and each one takes multiple hours to complete. However, some of the main story questlines don’t need to be completed at all to reach the end of the game.

So, for example, if you pick the right main story questline to complete and don’t take part in too much side content, you could be done with Atomfall significantly faster than our estimated timeline. However, on the flip side, if you see all of the main story questlines to their end, then you’ll exceed the timeline and could spend over 30 hours in Atomfall.

If you’re a completionist who wants to complete most or all of the main story questlines and partake in a majority of the side content, you could easily get 40+ hours out of the game. There are a plethora of side quests you can go on in the Quarantine Zone, and the main story questlines can have over a dozen individual quests each that all take some time to get through.

You’ll find your quest log will soon be chock-full of different leads to investigations that can either pan out quickly or take the entire game to resolve. A seemingly run-of-the-mill side quest can actually be how you reach the end of the game, and an apparently important character could really be insignificant after you do a few quests for them.

It’s up to you what leads you choose to chase and which ones you leave to the wayside. All quests in Atomfall lead you to different parts of the various maps in the game, though, so you’ll have to eventually visit every single map even if you want to get through the main story quickly.

Suffice it to say, Atomfall isn’t a game that will be beaten in the same amount of time by most players. Players can have a completely different experience from other players depending on the choices they make, who they choose to trust, and what quests they want to complete. All of this results in a game that can be beaten fairly quickly or take significantly longer than the average time to beat.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Game Pass Adds CFB 25 Today--But Only For Ultimate Subscribers
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/game-pass-adds-cfb-25-today-but-only-for-ultimate-subscribers/1100-6530430/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Xbox Game Pass Ultimate subscribers now have access to one of the most popular games of 2024. EA's College Football 25--the No. 2 best-selling game of 2024 in the US--is now available for Game Pass Ultimate members as part of EA Play.

College Football 25 is not available on PC, but Game Pass Ultimate members can play the game on the Xbox App for PC via cloud streaming as part of their subscription. This is the full version of College Football 25, not a trial; subscribers have unlimited access as long as their membership stays active.

EA Sports College Football 25 | Official Sights And Sounds Deep Dive Trailer

Want us to remember this setting for all your devices?

Sign up or Sign in now!

Please use a html5 video capable browser to watch videos.

This video has an invalid file format.

Sorry, but you can't access this content!

CFB 25 is not the only popular football game in the EA Play catalog, as Madden NFL 25 is there as well, alongside last year's EA Sports FC 24. Another perk of EA Play is access to 10-hour trials to EA's other games, including FC 25, NHL 25, EA Sports PGA Tour, and Dragon Age: The Veilguard, among others.

As mentioned, EA Play is only available through Game Pass Ultimate(or as its own subscription), so subscribers to Game Pass Standard or Core will not get to play CFB 25 as part of their membership. EA Play on its own costs $6/month, so anyone who wants just that membership can get it without Game Pass.

EA is now working on CFB 26, which is expected to launch in July. It was recently confirmed that student-athletes who opt in to participating in the game will receive payment of at least $1,500. More details about CFB 26 are expected to be announced in the coming months.

For more on what's coming to Game Pass in March 2025, be sure to check out the gallery below.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: New Pokemon: Legends Z-A Trailer Reveals Its Big Twist On Gameplay
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/new-pokemon-legends-z-a-trailer-reveals-its-big-twist-on-gameplay/1100-6530425/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The next entry in the Pokemon series, Pokemon Legends: Z-A, finally has a new trailer showcasing its core gameplay mechanic: the Z-A Royale.

Revealed during March 27's Nintendo Direct, Pokemon Legends: Z-A new gameplay twist takes place after the sun sets upon Lumiose City. Though the urban sprawl might be peaceful by day, at night the city takes on a different aura as highly skilled trainers wander the streets eager to battle and rank up in the Z-A Royale.

Want us to remember this setting for all your devices?

Sign up or Sign in now!

Please use a html5 video capable browser to watch videos.

This video has an invalid file format.

Sorry, but you can't access this content!

Now Playing: Pokémon Legends: Z-A - Official Z-A Royale Gameplay Trailer

As a Lumoise City newcomer, your trainer will enter the tournament at Rank Z and be forced to duke it out at night in order to become Rank A. Though the trailer didn't reveal everything that comes with earning this coveted title, it did share that trainers who reach the top are "said to have a wish granted."

Like Pokemon Legends: Z-A's Wild Zones, these dusk-'til-dawn duels will be contained to designated areas called Battle Zones, which will be indicated by red, holographic borders. Once your trainer steps foot in these areas, other trainers will be eager to challenge them, making timing and the way you approach certain opponents critical to success.

The French-inspired Lumiose City, which serves as the Kalos region's main hub, will be familiar to those who played Pokemon X and Y. However, Legends Z-A further realizes the location by greatly expanding it and adding in plenty of new characters, new locations, and wild Pokemon. Players will be able to battle and capture these wild Pokemon regardless of if they are tucked away in one of the city's Wild Zones or lurking up on the rooftops.

Pokemon: Legends Z-A is the second entry in the Pokemon: Legends spin-off. While the mainline Pokemon series sees players traverse an entire region, battling gym leaders to earn the title of Pokemon Master, the Legends series confines players to a more fully-realized version of a particular location. In Pokemon Legends: Arceus, players traveled back in time to the settlement of the Sinnoh region. In GameSpot's Pokemon Legends: Arceus review, we wrote that the game is a "significant reimagining of what makes a Pokemon game, with an exciting level of flexibility."

According to the game's press release, Pokemon Legends: Z-A is currently scheduled to launch on the "Nintendo Switch family of systems" in late 2025. Though additional information on Pokemon Legends: Z-A is scarce, those eager to learn more can check out our overview of the game's three starter Pokemon.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: SaGa Frontier 2 Remastered Is Out Today On Nintendo Switch
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/saga-frontier-2-remastered-is-out-today-on-nintendo-switch/1100-6530429/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

After 25 years, Square Enix is breathing new life into a classic RPG with the reveal of SaGa Frontier 2 Remastered. Originally a PlayStation exclusive, the new version of the game will launch today on Nintendo Switch, PC, PS4, PS5, and mobile devices.

SaGa Frontier 2 Remastered was unveiled at today's Nintendo Direct. Square Enix is adding brand-new events to the RPG, alongside the ability to "team up with more characters in battle," per the trailer (seen below). SaGa Frontier 2 Remastered is also promising quality-of-life improvements.

The beloved RPG returns -- fully remastered for modern platforms!
SaGa Frontier 2 Remastered brings back its signature watercolor visuals, deep strategic battles, and entwined narratives, now with quality of life improvements, new story events, and more. pic.twitter.com/wrwxDbHwkl

— SaGa Series @ #SaGaFrontier2 available today! (@SaGaGame) March 27, 2025

The RPG first launched for PlayStation in 2000 for North American audiences (1999 in Japan) and follows two protagonists: Gustave and William Knights. SaGa Frontier 2 Remastered, like the original, lets you choose from various events in Sandail's history. The user-interface has been improved for this new version, according to the Square Enix website. Another addition will be postgame content, such as the opportunity to "fight enhanced bosses as extra battle content."

Almost four years ago, SaGa Frontier Remastered was announced. Meanwhile, the sequel wasn't the only Square Enix RPG remaster getting some spotlight at today's Nintendo Direct, either. Dragon Quest 1 and 2 HD Remake also got highlighted and will arrive later this year. To keep up with more Switch news, Nintendo rolled out the Nintendo Today app for smartphones.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Ultimate Marvel Vs. Capcom 3 Community Edition Mod Adds Over 60 Playable Characters
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/ultimate-marvel-vs-capcom-3-community-edition-mod-adds-over-60-playable-characters/1100-6530418/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Back in August 2023, a massive modding project for Ultimate Marvel Vs. Capcom 3--known as the Community Edition--was announced by members of the UMvC3 modding community. Today, the team behind the mods has announced that the full version of Ultimate Marvel Vs. Capcom 3 Community Edition is now available to download--and it's brought nearly 70 new characters to the game.

The modders released a new trailer to celebrate the launch of the mod, which showcases a few of the most recent characters modded into the game. Rival Schools's Kyosuke Kagami, Devil May Cry's Nero, and Bad Box Art Megaman--complete with a realistic German Shepherd version of Rush--are all included in the video.

The Community Edition modders have slowly added characters to the game since that initial 2023 announcement, but the pack released today adds 67 different fighters to the playable roster, each with unique moves, animations, and more. The mod's NexusMods listing also includes full movelists for each of the new additions for those interested in testing out some of the newest names.

The full list of characters added to Ultimate Marvel Vs. Capcom 3 through the Community Edition mod is as follows:

  • Capcom
    • Shadow Lady
    • Evil Ryu
    • Lilith
    • S.T.A.R.S. Wesker
    • Phoenix & Maya
    • Shin Akuma
    • Chris (S.T.A.R.S)
    • Ken
    • DMC 1 Dante
    • Rashid
    • Monster Hunter
    • HUNK
    • Cammy
    • Asura
    • Guile
    • Charlie
    • Leon
    • Krauser
    • Jake
    • Sherry
    • Sakura
    • Batsu
    • Captain Commando
    • Talbain
    • Megaman X
    • Jill (S.T.A.R.S.)
    • Servbot
    • Dan Hibiki
    • Gloria
    • DMC5 Vergil
    • Nero
    • Strider 2099
    • M. Bison
    • Hinata
    • Hayato
    • Kyosuke
    • Saki
    • Yun
    • Bad Box Art Mega Man
    • Juri
  • Marvel
    • Orange Hulk
    • Spider-Gwen
    • All New Wolverine
    • Red She-Hulk
    • Captain Marvel
    • MVC2 Sentinel
    • Cyclops
    • Jean Grey
    • Thanos
    • Psylocke
    • Ultron
    • Moonstone
    • Bishop
    • IceMan
    • Gambit
    • Venom
    • Carnage
    • Shocker
    • Blackheart
    • King Thor
    • Stranger
    • US Agent
    • Clea
    • The Thing
    • Colossus
    • Onslaught
    • Carter Slade
    • War Machine

Ultimate Marvel Vs. Capcom 3 Community Edition is available to download now, though it will require the PC version of the base game to install.

Jason Fanelli on Google+

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
